name: seventh son

attributes.attribute: reputed to be such a gifted—or cursed— individual
believed that such people could see the double of a person who was about to die
survives in some areas of America where significant immigration from Celtic lands occurred

sources: Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: Folklore often includes the notion of a seventh son possessing a special talent due to his birth order. This belief is prevalent in many Celtic-influenced areas, where the seventh son of a seventh son is considered to be either exceptionally gifted or cursed with Second Sight. In the Cotswolds, for example, it was believed that such individuals could perceive a person's double, a sign that their death was imminent (see Co-Walker). This concept has persisted in some parts of the United States, particularly those with a high rate of immigration from Celtic regions.
